display_long_description:
OG Lethal Ape Redux drops you into a cold, abandoned facility where something has gone horribly wrong. Harsh fluorescent lights buzz overhead, concrete walls close in around you, and empty rooms feel watched—even when they’re silent. What was once a controlled environment is now a hunting ground.

Movement is entirely physics-based, inspired by Gorilla Tag. You don’t run with buttons—you move with your body. Push off walls, crawl through tight spaces, vault across rooms, and desperately climb to safety using only your arms. Every escape is physical, frantic, and fueled by panic.

But you are not alone.

Roaming the halls are Scary Baboons—twisted, humanoid apes that stalk the facility with disturbing intent. Some wear remnants of their past lives: helmets, uniforms, disguises. Others are darker, quieter, and harder to spot until it’s too late. They don’t follow simple paths. They wander, listen, and react. Once they see you, they don’t stop.

Storage rooms, supply areas, and long corridors become death traps. Metal shelves block your movement. Corners hide danger. Open spaces offer no safety—only longer chases. You’ll hear footsteps before you see them. Breathing before screams. And when a baboon enters the room, the only question is whether your movement is fast enough.

Survive by mastering momentum, learning the layout, and staying calm under pressure. There are no weapons. No easy outs. Just you, your instincts, and whatever path you can carve through the environment befo
